laboratory_examinations.procedure_name: 24-h urinary excretion of catecholamines and total metanephrines
laboratory_examinations.findings: Increased excretion; total metanephrines: 9.1 micromoles (normal <16.6), norepinephrine: 4622 nmol (normal <1473), epinephrine: 24 nmol (normal <109), dopamine: 2808 nmol (normal <2612).
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: The levels did not normalize postoperatively and remained elevated and stable during follow-up.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Showed uptake in the liver, left femur, and posterior mediastinum near the aortic arch.
Large hypervascular lobulated mass in the caudate and right lobes of the liver, causing complete occlusion of the vena cava.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: There was no pronounced change in size of the mass compared with previous images.

laboratory_examinations.procedure_name: Genetic testing of SDHB, SDHC, and SDHD genes
laboratory_examinations.findings: A missense point mutation was identified in the SDHB gene: c.725G>A (R242H mutation); no mutations in SDHD and SDHC genes.

laboratory_examinations.procedure_name: 24-h urinary excretion of catecholamines and total metanephrines (post-operative)
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Remained normal when checked every 6 months through April 2002.
